de.tub.data.dao
Interface IUserDAO<E>

All Superinterfaces:
IDao
All Known Implementing Classes:
Neo4JUserDAO
public interface IUserDAO<E>
extends IDao

This interface provides methods to access users. The IUserDAO is part of the Data Access Object design pattern.

Author:
Sebastian Oelke

Method Summary
 void addRootHGCluster(E user, E root)
          Connects the given user node with the given hg root node.
 void addRootUser(E referenceNode, E root)
          Connects the given root user node with the reference node of the graph.
 void connectSimilarUsers(E userNodeOne, E userNodeTwo, Object weight)
          Connects the first user node with the second user node and applies the given weight to the connection between them.
 E createUser(Object id)
          Creates and saves a user.
 void deleteUser(Object id)
          Deletes the user with the given id.
 List<E> findAll()
          Finds all users.
 E findUserById(Object id)
          Finds a user by means of its identifier.
 

Method Detail

createUser

E createUser(Object id)
Creates and saves a user.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of this user.
Returns:
the created node or null if the node could not be created.

deleteUser

void deleteUser(Object id)
Deletes the user with the given id.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the user to delete.

findUserById

E findUserById(Object id)
Finds a user by means of its identifier.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the user to find.
Returns:
the user with the given identifier or null if no user was found.

findAll

List<E> findAll()
Finds all users.

Returns:
all persisted users.

addRootHGCluster

void addRootHGCluster(E user,
                      E root)
Connects the given user node with the given hg root node.

Parameters:
user - the user to which to connect the hg root node to.
root - the hg root cluster to connect with.

addRootUser

void addRootUser(E referenceNode,
                 E root)
Connects the given root user node with the reference node of the graph.

Parameters:
referenceNode - the reference node of the graph to which to connect the root user node to.
root - the root user node.

connectSimilarUsers

void connectSimilarUsers(E userNodeOne,
                         E userNodeTwo,
                         Object weight)
Connects the first user node with the second user node and applies the given weight to the connection between them.

Parameters:
userNodeOne - the first user node.
userNodeTwo - the second user node.
weight - the weight to apply to the connection between user node one and user node two.
